Description: The primary criminal code of India covering various offenses.

Law_Name: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989
Description: Aimed at preventing atrocities against SCs and STs.

Law_Name: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
Description: Protects women from domestic violence.

Law_Name: Protection of Children from Sexual Offenses Act, 2012
Description: Provides for the protection of children from sexual offenses.

Law_Name: Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015
Description: Governs the care and protection of juveniles in conflict with law.
New provisions related to cybersecurity and offenses in the digital domain.
Amended laws related to sexual offenses and crimes against women.

Law_Name: The Indecent Representation of Women (Prohibition) Act, 1986
Description: Prohibits indecent representation of women in media.
Prevents the giving or receiving of dowry.

Description: Protects women from sexual harassment at the workplace.
Regulates the employment of children in various occupations.

The primary legislation on the procedure for administration of substantive criminal law in India.
Governs the admissibility of evidence in Indian courts and includes rules for relevancy, admission, and presentation of evidence.
Prevents money laundering and provides for confiscation of property derived from, or involved in, money laundering.

Law_Name: Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985
Description: Regulates the operations related to narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances and provides for measures to prevent their trafficking.
Regulates the acquisition, possession, manufacture, sale, import, export, and transport of arms and ammunition.
Provides protection to wild animals, birds, and plants, and ensures the ecological and environmental security of the country.
Regulates the export trade in antiquities and art treasures and prevents smuggling and fraudulent dealings in antiquities.
Empowers citizens to request information from a public authority, promoting transparency and accountability in the working of the government.
Establishes a National Human Rights Commission for the promotion and protection of human rights.

Law_Name: Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009
Description: Provides for free and compulsory education to all children in the age group of six to fourteen years.

Law_Name: Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015
Description: Provides for the care, protection, and rehabilitation of children in conflict with the law and children in need of care and protection.
Amends the Information Technology Act, 2000, to provide legal recognition to electronic transactions, digital signatures, and data protection.
Defines the laws related to theft and robbery, providing a comprehensive framework for the prosecution and punishment of these offenses.
Prevents atrocities against Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes and provides for special courts to try offenses under the Act.
Protects the interests of consumers by establishing authorities for timely and effective administration and settlement of consumer disputes.
Regulates contracts relating to the sale of goods, indemnity and guarantee, bailment and pledge, agency, etc.
Regulates the partnership firms and provides for their registration, rights, duties, and liabilities.
Regulates contracts relating to the sale of goods and provides for the rights and duties of buyers and sellers.
Regulates the law relating to negotiable instruments such as promissory notes, bills of exchange, and cheques.
